column4: hello guys, i execute this command: $ aptitude install ruby1.9.1 ruby1.9.1-dev ruby1.9.1-examples ruby1.9.1-full rubybook rubygems-doc rubygems1.9.1 libmysql-ruby1.9.1 libpgsql-ruby1.9.1 libxml-ruby1.9.1 libnokogiri-ruby1.9.1 libhttpclient-ruby1.9.1 libzip-ruby1.9.1 libspreadsheet-ruby1.9.1 libtwitter-ruby1.9.1 why im getting The program 'ruby' is currently not installed. when trying 'ruby -v' to check the ruby version installed ?? can anyone bring me so
me clue?
when you do ruby -v what do you see
i see The program 'ruby' is currently not installed.
can you help me?
ok so use the package manager to install it
i use it, did you see the command i execute, i use aptitude
what can i do?
im stucked dont know what to do
oly562 ok guys, will try synaptic then
oly562 i already installed ruby1.9.1 using Synaptic, same thing: The program 'ruby' is currently not installed.
type "ruby in a shell and hit tab a few times, no space eg: ruby<tab>
i see, i think is installed with another name, this version
it seems working with a new name
what name
thanks jeje
it is working with ruby1.9.1 not ruby as before
ok, so your missing a symlink, it's normally ln -s ruby1.9.1 /usr/bin/ruby
that symlink should have been setup at package install
i dont understand what happened on installation...
I can't explain that as I didn't follow your install, but put a symlink from ruby1.9.1 to ruby and it will be fine
tks, i already did the symlink, working now
nice job, well done
